MPDL Services for researchers
We are here to help you! 
MPDL services help researchers during data acquisition, safe data storage and collaborative working on data as they are generated. Services for finalized datasets (long-term archival and, if applicable, open sharing of research data) will be mentioned in the "After research" chapter.
 
All services are available to Max Planck researchers and - upon invitation - their external collaboration partners. Your data will stay within the Max Planck Society.

Electronic laboratory notebook advice
Thorough documentation of experimental procedures (sample preparation, instrument settings, calibration, quality control, …) for data acquisition is essential to answer questions that can arise during later phases of the research process: data processing and synthesis, interpretation and writing up of results in scientific papers or Ph.D. thesis.
 
Traditionally-historically, such laboratory notes were taken on paper, which has several disadvantages:
  • It is not possible to include information already present in digital form, namely most output of scientific instruments (all that can be done, and is done is paste/glue printouts).
  • Your handwriting may be(come) illegible for others, or even for your future self.
  • Paper notes cannot be accessed remotely.
  • Major projects may require a series of labbooks.
  • Paper notes aren’t automatically searchable, thus retrieving details well after an experiment was conducted may be tedious and time-consuming – if at all possible.
  • Paper notes cannot be easily edited – no options such as Copy, Paste, Delete or Insert (text).
  • It isn’t possible to create and use templates for recurrent processes.
  • Paper notes have limited if any options for contributions by multiple group members.
 

 
Electronic laboratory notebooks (ELNs) offer far more flexibility, structure to data and digital preservation potential. Various ELN solutions have different features that may be particularly suitable for certain scientific fields or analytical methods – MPDL can make suggestions after discussing your specific needs.
 
labfolder is the ELN solution licensed for all Max Planck researchers and their project partners.
